arts.ttl: Crystal Palace boss reveals reason behind Cheick Doucoure substitution decision in Ipswich win
arts.sum: Oliver Glasner revealed that Cheick Doucoure was substituted off at half-time in Crystal Palace’s 1-0 win at Ipswich on Tuesday to avoid a red card. “It was because of the yellow card,” said Glasner.

arts.ttl: Glasner: We fought for that victory
arts.sum: Oliver Glasner praised Crystal Palace’s fight – and their raucous backing on a cold Tuesday night at Portman Road – after Jean-Philippe Mateta’s well-taken goal secured a first away win of the season.

arts.ttl: McKenna disappointed as Ipswich's wait for first home win goes on
arts.sum: Ipswich Town boss Kieran McKenna says another defeat at Portman Road is "very disappointing" as the Tractor Boys remain the only side without a Premier League home win this season.

arts.ttl: Glasner hails 'amazing' Mateta winner for Palace
arts.sum: Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner praises Jean-Philippe Mateta's "amazing" as the Eagles earned their first Premier League away win of the season by beating Ipswich Town.

arts.ttl: Oliver Glasner delivers verdict Crystal Palace’s second Premier League win of the season - Mateta nets winner in Ipswich victory
arts.sum: Oliver Glasner said Crystal Palace were the better side and fully deserved their 1-0 win at Ipswich on Tuesday evening. Palace took the lead in the 59th minute when Jean-Philippe Mateta burst towards goal and brushed aside Jacob Greeves to chip Muric with his left foot to open the scoring.

arts.ttl: Oliver Glasner: Crystal Palace are heading in right direction after Ipswich win
arts.sum: It is now two wins and three draws from the last six matches for Glasner’s side.

arts.ttl: Vote now: Palace's Player of the Match versus Ipswich
arts.sum: Crystal Palace secured a first away win of the season against Ipswich Town on Tuesday night – and now it's time to vote for your Player of the Match!

arts.ttl: Jean-Philippe Mateta on target as Crystal Palace beat fellow strugglers Ipswich
arts.sum: Mateta struck in the second half to secure a 1-0 success for the Eagles with the only real piece of quality in a nervy encounter.

arts.ttl: Marc Guehi ignores FA warning with new rainbow armband message as Sam Morsy again goes without
arts.sum: The club captain has again displayed a religious message across the show of support for the LGBTQ+ community

arts.ttl: Gallery: The best photos as Palace take on Ipswich
arts.sum: Crystal Palace are in action against Ipswich Town in the Premier League for the first time since 1995 – follow the best photos from Portman Road below!
